turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Dander.
turn.2: Dander  Dander is material shed from the body of humans and animals that have fur, hair, or feathers.
turn.3: Is it a symptom of an underlying condition?
turn.4: The term is similar to dandruff, when an excess of flakes becomes visible.
turn.6: Skin flakes that come off the main body of an animal are dander, while the flakes of skin called dandruff come from the scalp and are composed of epithelial skin cells.
turn.8: The surface layer of mammalian skin is called the stratum corneum, which is shed as part of normal skin replacement.
turn.9: Is it a cause for concern?
turn.10: Dander is microscopic, and can be transported through the air in house dust, where it forms the diet of the dust mites.
turn.11: Can dander cause any other issues?
turn.12: Through the air, dander can enter the mucous membranes in the nose and lungs, causing allergies in susceptible individuals, largely through the mechanism of allergy to proteins in the bodies of the dust mites that live on dander.
